result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Status conference on November 21, 2022 at 01:15 pm.
ADA Colleen Lennon appeared for the State. Attorney Sarah Zwach appeared in person on behalf of defn, STC scheduled, NIH.
Status conference on October 7, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
from Atty Zwach re resetting STC
Status Conference scheduled for August 16, 2022 rescheduled per attorney request

*** IN CUSTODY ***

02:13 PM Defendant appeared.  ADA Carl Jacob Lazarus appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court and parties address letter filed with the Court by the Defendant and status of finding attorney for Defendant. Defendant withdraws his request for Speedy Trial as he would like to wait for an attorney.
Status conference on July 11, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
Status conference on August 16, 2022 at 01:45 pm.
from defn to Judge Reynolds re his Writ of Habeas Corpus
Defendant in custody. Attorney has not been appointed through spd. STC rescheduled.
Bond form returned unsigned. Def refused.
Copy of minutes from BBH Hrg on 6/16/22 and bond form sent electronically to DCJ.

The Court ordered a signature bond on the condition that the defendant reports to and complies with Pretrial Services. The defendant shall report to Pretrial Services by 10:00 A.M. on the business day following his/her release from jail. The following checked category(s) are also ordered: _X_ GPS, __ Remote Breath (Alcohol) Monitoring, and/or __ Random Drug Testing.
- Your signature bond is set in the amount of $500 per case. You may be responsible for paying this amount if you miss a court date or do not follow conditions of your release.
- Defendant shall not have any contact, direct or indirect, with Ashira W or Richard W. 
- Defendant shall not possess any type of dangerous weapon [as defined by Wis. Stat. 939.22(10)]. 
- Defendant shall not use/possess controlled substances or drug paraphernalia without a valid prescription. 
NONCOMPLIANCE WILL BE REPORTED BY DCPS TO THE JUDICIARY WHO SHALL RESPOND IN ONE OF THESE WAYS: Schedule bail hearing, Increase Supervision, Issue warrant, No change but monitor.
Referral to Dane County Pretrial Services

*** IN CUSTODY ***

10:59 AM Defendant appeared.  ADA Carl Jacob Lazarus appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court colloquy with defendant regarding Waiver of Right to an Attorney and Speedy Trial Demand. Defendant does not waive his right to an Attorney. 
RE: BBH
Court reduces bail to signature bond and requires GPS montitoring if bail is posted.

Defendant in court, in custody with Attorney Richard S Burris.  Paul W. Humphrey appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney Burris' motion to withdraw. Court has colloquy with DE in regards to attorney withdrawing. Court grants withdrawal of counsel.

Re: Motion to Withdraw

Court makes statement regarding Motion to Withdraw and other cases of Defendant. Court Defers decision on Motion to Judge on oldest case, Judge Berz 20CF1526.

Information was e-filed with the court and a copy was given to the defendant; Defn waived reading of Information; Counsel enters a plea of not guilty on behalf of Defendant; motions due within 20 days; bail continued

State requests that Counts 3-5 be transactually related. Court approves request. Law Enforcement duly sworn & testified; Venue Established; Witness ID'd defn; State moves for bindover - waives argument, reserves for rebuttal; Defense objects to bindover - argument; Rebuttal by State. Ct binds case over; bail continued
